availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jonathan F. Payne (Hancock County, KY, grocer and postmaster)

body.p: Hancock County, Kentucky, grocer and postmaster. Married to Mary Payne. Father of Mary Payne, H. Payne and Belle Payne. Grocer in Hancock County in 1860. Postmaster of Lewisport, Kentucky, from August 27, 1861, to August 30, 1866.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 983.
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971, NARA Microfilm Publication, M841, Records of the Post Office Department, Record Group Number 28 (accessed via Ancestry.com on March 22, 2017).
St. Louis Globe-Democrat (St. Louis, Missouri), October 2, 1884.
